definition: to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to bring to justice/to hand over to the law

sentences.english: When necessary the case may be transferred for trial to the People's Court in the principal place where the crime was committed.
sentences.chinese: 在必要的時候，可以移送主要犯罪地的人民法院審判。

sentences.english: Billy removed to foster care and joins a gang.
sentences.chinese: 比利被移送到託管人家，加入了流氓團伙。

sentences.english: Send mail to poster when their posting is held for approval?
sentences.chinese: 當投書遭留置移送裁決時是否要通知寄信人？

sentences.english: In most cases, the losing party must petition the Court through a writ of certiorari to hear the case.
sentences.chinese: 必須通過訴訟文件移送命令請求法庭審理案件。

sentences.english: Cases suspected of constituting a crime shall be transferred to the judicial department for prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 涉嫌犯罪的要及時移送司法機關追究刑事責任。

sentences.english: Suspect transgressive of will move to send a communal security the institution the treating by law.
sentences.chinese: 涉嫌犯罪的將依法移送公安機關處理。

sentences.english: The distraint as evidence shall be transferred with the case.
sentences.chinese: 對作爲證據使用的扣押物品，應當隨案移送。

sentences.english: Adopt the workpiece structure of multi-armed deportation, the cleaning is of high efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 超聲波清洗機採用多臂移送工件結構，清洗效率高。

definition: to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
